SEARCH
Package org.hms.services.staffmanagement

Class StaffTable

java.lang.Object
org.hms.entities.AbstractTable<Staff>
org.hms.services.staffmanagement.StaffTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class StaffTable extends AbstractTable<Staff>
The StaffTable class extends the AbstractTable class to manage staff data, specifically providing functionality to save to and load from a CSV file. It uses a default file path, and each entry represents a staff member with fields such as staffId, age, name, role, status, and gender.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • dataRoot

      private static final String dataRoot
      The root directory where all data files are stored. This path is constructed using the current user directory and appending "/data/". It is used as a base directory for loading and saving data files specific to the StaffTable.

    • USERS_FILE

      private static final String USERS_FILE
      A constant that holds the file path for the users' CSV file. The file path is constructed by appending "users.csv" to the data root directory.

  • Constructor Details

    • StaffTable

      public StaffTable()
      Default constructor for the StaffTable class. Initializes a new instance by invoking the superclass's constructor to set up necessary fields and structures for managing staff entries.

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile() throws IOException
      Saves the StaffTable to the designated file.

      This method overrides the superclass method to save the current state of the staff table, including headers and individual staff entries, to a CSV file. The file location is determined by the class's filePath property.

      Overrides:
      saveToFile in class AbstractTable<Staff>
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing to the file

    • loadFromFile

      public void loadFromFile() throws IOException
      Loads the staff entries from a predefined file. This method overrides the parent class's implementation to load staff data specifically from the designated file.
      Overrides:
      loadFromFile in class AbstractTable<Staff>
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during reading from the file

    • loadUsers

      private Map<String,User> loadUsers()
      Loads user data from the USERS_FILE into a Map. Each user is represented as a line in the file, with fields separated by commas. The first line of the file is assumed to be a header and is skipped. If a line contains exactly 4 fields, it is parsed into a User object and added to the map.
      Returns:
      a Map where the key is the user ID and the value is the corresponding User object

    • saveUsers

      private void saveUsers(Map<String,User> users)
      Saves the provided users to a file.
      Parameters:
      users - a map containing users to be saved, where the key is the user's ID and the value is the User object

    • removeEntry

      public boolean removeEntry(int tableEntryID)
      Removes an entry with the specified tableEntryID from the staff table. This method will update the underlying data file and remove the associated user.
      Overrides:
      removeEntry in class AbstractTable<Staff>
      Parameters:
      tableEntryID - the unique identifier of the table entry to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the entry is successfully removed, false if the entry with the specified ID is not found
